content:
I have #76204 on me to review, and it adds new unstable APIs. As unstable I know it doesn't need a full libs FCP, but is there a suggestion of how much of an FYI to give? Should I avoid r+'ing until at least one libs member says "ok, that seems reasonable"?

(The request in the issue makes sense to me, it's a thing that's been valuable in the iterator implementation for years now, I'd like to have it for the Try implementation, and ecstatic-morse would also like it for graph traversals (like the OP) in rust. But none of those are an explicit libs ok...)
FWIW one of my PRs got approved with only one reviewer https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72310
although David Tolnay is very well known for libs work so maybe not a 1-1 comparison ^^
Yes, unstable API additions need only one libs team "seems good," and not necessarily of the exact API (e.g., a comment on an issue is usually sufficient)
@Joshua Nelson I can comment on that patch if you want, I have some suggestions.
if you have api suggestions go for it :) but i don't think the implementation is worth worrying about since it's on nightly without much use
Nah, just some comments on the documentation and type signature.
I don't know why but I do seemed to comment quite a lot on documentations, including misdreavus ones.
